Meanwhile, an exceptional feature on Thandie Newton has us pumped up, and people cutting cakes that look like things that are not cakes has us confused. The Free Britney movement is rising again, giving new context to her social media posts. And a new look wetsuit has Myf absolutely jazzed.

item.title: #131 Hamilton, High Fidelity, Harpers | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description It’s open season on open letters denouncing cancellation culture. But are the people calling the call outs just replicating what they’re fighting against? Yeezy season is well and truly upon us, with Kanye running for President. And we’re digging into the latest adaptation of High Fidelity, and what do we make of Hamilton on the small screen? Show Notes SMH Open Letter: https://www.smh.com.au/culture/movies/something-dangerously-askew-with-the-way-we-re-talking-about-race-and-the-arts-20200706-p559bz.html Harpers Open Letter: https://harpers.org/a-letter-on-justice-and-open-debate/ Kanye in Forbes: https://www.

item.title: #130: Kanye, The Nest Boyfriend, Eurovision Movie | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description By popular demand, Eurovision host and expert Myf weighs in on Will Ferrell’s Eurovision movie "The Story of Fire Saga". While Zan bangs on about Mrs America. Kanye and Kim have had a big week of music, fashion, and Freesian horses, and we’re here for it. All of it. And a “Ken and Karen” of Missouri are the pin ups of white privilege, and the source of many a meme.

item.title: #129: Dyson Heydon, Barbie Quarantine, Sashay Away Segway | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description An investigation into sexual harassment at the highest levels of Australian law has us talking about the systemic abuse of power that women are subjected to every day. It’s the end of the road for the Segway, and the start of a new project by Beyonce. And an American comedian has made our week with her Barbie Quarantine Dreamhouse. Show Notes: Myf’s Sovereign Hill Deb dress: https://twitter.com/MyfWarhurst/status/1275675671176663055 Zan’s “anti-Deb” dress: https://twitter.

item.title: #128: Callout Culture or Accountability, 1997 Fashion, Debutante | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Can callout culture create actionable change? The removing and recontextualising of past problematic art is one thing, but we’re reminded to keep our foot on the pedal when there are some big issues at stake. A piece on 1997 fashion is a stretch (but of course we’ll take it), and a new podcast on Debutante Balls has us looking at this old tradition through a new lens. Show Notes

item.title: #127 A Reckoning, A Rowling, A Rousing | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description The world is responding to call outs for change, with major publications, streaming services, and organisations taking responsibility for past practices and platforming, and also reassessing how they work differently into the future. TV shows are buried, statues of slave traders are toppled, while some are only just learning that Tom Morello’s rage isn’t against his dishwasher. JK Rowling has doubled down on her stance on trans women, causing Potterheads (not least recent fan Zan) to question their connection to her books.

item.title: #126 The Return, Blackout Tuesday, COVID Farshun | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description The world is a very different place to where we left you more than eight months ago! And we’re catching up on what we’ve learned in this new “normal”. Following the killing of George Floyd, and protests in both America and Australia on racial injustice, the music industry this week responded with a blackout. But the confused messaging on social media has people wondering if these conversation will continue beyond the news cycle.

item.title: It is happening | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description It's a Tiger King free zone, but there is so much that Myf and Zan have watched, read and heard that they can't wait to discuss with you. Yes, Bang On is back THIS WEEK. You won't have to wait long Bang Fam. They will be at a safe distance but no topic is safe - farshun, hot takes & convos about music, art, life and stuff are all back on the table.

item.title: Hello, is this thing on? | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are back! After 9 months away they're almost ready to bang on again. Are YOU ready Bang Fam? Stay tuned... Transcript

item.title: #125: Greta Thunberg, JVN, Unbelievable | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are reunited and catching up on another massive week. On the east coast of America, Greta Thunberg is making waves with her impassioned fight for climate change action but a certain type of man is bent on bringing her down. Meanwhile on the west, the Emmys are on and we’re dissecting the farshun on ground. Jonathan Van Ness is absent, but in the news for other reasons: a revealing interview with the New York Times.

item.title: #124: Hannah Gadsby, Muting Trolls, Berghain | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf wakes Zan up at a ridiculous hour in Germany, where she’s been busy trying to get into all the coolest clubs, before she begins her judging duties for the ANCHOR – Reeperbahn Festival International Music Award. We celebrate Hannah Gadsby’s Emmy win while questioning how Beyonce missed out on six awards. As well, suggested new rules for dealing with trolls have us thinking about the best way to deal with nastiness online.

item.title: #123: Parma, Caroline Calloway, Snowball | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are dealing with another bad take by a repeat offender, and going in to bat for the chicken parma. A long read in The Cut has the internet ablaze, but why are we so thirsty for watching public take downs? And the unveiling of a statue of AFLW player Tayla Harris speaks for more than just one woman. We’re banging on about a gripping new podcast, and there’s some big Bang news to share with the Bang Fam too.

item.title: #122: Flume, Taylor vs Tool, Unwanted Kisses | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description #122: Flume, Taylor vs Tool, Unwanted Kisses Myf and Zan sink their teeth into another big week, and it’s a real peach. Flume has been setting the internet on fire with his antics at Burning Man, Taylor Swift fans don’t know or understand Tool and it’s a vibe. Meanwhile an unwanted kiss at a charity event sparks a conversation around the different greetings men and women receive, and the earliest invasions of personal space.

item.title: #121: Missy Elliott, Pizzadilla, G7 wives | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description What a smorgasbord of hot topics Myf and Zan have this week. The MTV VMA’s have given us eye candy for days, and peaked with two killer performances from legends, new and old. Someone has mapped and analysed Taylor Swift’s journey “London Boy”, and we’re here for it (and how much it’d cost), and a food video has taken things too far. Meanwhile the G7 is on, and the tenets of sexism are on full display with the leaders wives.

item.title: #120: Billie Eilish, Branded Podcasts, Convict Slang | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan start their week with a story about dogs watching musicals, and go from there. A piece on how podcasts are pitching products has us thinking about the creative (and sometimes insidious) ways brands are selling. And a conversation between Pharrell Williams and Billie Eilish has us punching our fists in the air for the present. Meanwhile the 200th anniversary of a dictionary strikes a chord, and Myf is banging on about ponies (up there with Paddle Steamers).

item.title: #119: BTS, Art & Instagram, Succession | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are back from Brisbane and still flying high after a Bang Fam reunion in the sunshine state. South Korea’s most famous boy band is taking a breather, and it marks a shift in how the industry treats it’s biggest stars. A piece on art feeding your soul in the age of social media has us jazzed… How can art touch your soul when your soul is busy posing on Instagram?

item.title: #118: Bang On Live in Brisbane | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan finally make the pilgrimage to Brisvegas, for a special live recording of Bang On and boy howdy, do the Bang Fam show up! It’s our first date with Brissie so, with some help from the Guardian, we make all the right choices about etiquette. Tarantino’s latest epic hasn’t come out yet but – much like the internet – we’re here to dish some hot takes without having seen it.

item.title: #117: Queer Eye, Millennial Disney, Meghan Vogue | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description With a new season of Queer Eye out, Myf and Zan are digging in and noticing shifts in the Fab Five’s approach to makeovers. A rant online about who should and shouldn’t be at Disneyworld has Zan worked up (and planning her next visit). Meanwhile the September issue of British Vogue has a guest editor who’s turning the focus on others. And we’re banging on about two Australian docos that have us reflecting back on who we are.

item.title: #116: Masterchef, Cats, World Music | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description You’re hot then you’re cold but you’re always bang on. It’s the end of an era for our Masterchef judges and we have some spicy takes on Matt, George, and Gary’s departure. We’re calling into question a “definitive list” of the best bikkies, and have more than a few queries about the movie trailer for Cats. And in 2019, do we really need the category of “world music”? Ahead of WOMAD in the UK, a great opinion piece sparks the convo once again.

item.title: #115: Princess Di, 007, Chernobyl | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description #115: Princess Di, 007, Chernobyl Myf and Zan are reunited after their respective Bali sojourns, and there is a LOT to catch up on. David Campbell truly believes his son is Princess Di reincarnated so there’s that. Meanwhile the internet is buzzing with a new 007 in town, and Lil Nas X checking in with Keanu and Dolly. We’re in front of the box too, banging on about tv shows hyped and hidden online.

item.title: #114: Women’s World Cup, Jeffrey Epstein, Influencers | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Zan invites Jan Fran back into the Bang Fam this week, while Myf is on hols. The victory of the US Women’s Team in the World Cup has everyone talking, particularly about the pay gap. Jeffrey Epstein is having his day of reckoning, sparking a discussion around complicity, connection, and whether the structures that protect abusers are shifting in the wake of #MeToo. And a brilliant long read in Vanity Fair about linen loving Byron Bay babes has us digging into the social media sell once again.

item.title: #113: Logies, Taylor Vs Scooter, Michael Hutchence | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf’s away so Clare Bowditch is coming to play as a special guest Banger! It’s been a juicy week too, with the Gold Logie going to Gleeson. Should we / do we care about the Logies? Taylor Swift’s public fight for her master recordings gets an explanation from Clare, as we ponder the power of the artist. And Celine Dion is in Paris for Couture Fashion Week. Enough said.

item.title: #112: Being Beyonce’s Assistant, Body Makeup, Rethinking Productivity | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description While Zan’s away Myf and Meshel Laurie play - and boy, are they hopeless at the new choose your own adventure twitter game, Being Beyonce’s Assistant For The Day. As well, we have ALL the thoughts on Kim Kardashian’s new makeup range for the body - and while we’re at it, we do some deep reflection on how to live our lives in a post social media age.

item.title: #111: Garlic, Gay Anthems, Gender bans | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description The internet has gifted Myf and Zan this week, with shortcuts to cooking glory and cat filters for days. Pride Month in America is sparking lots of conversations about queer subcultures becoming the mainstream, and we’re digging into all the hot takes. And over in the UK big organisations are taking affirmative action on gender equality. Beryl pops by too. God love her. Show notes: Pakistani politician’s cat filter: https://www.

item.title: #110: Handmaid's Jenner, Cool to be Alone, Big Little Lies | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are capturing the week that was including birthday parties and OH BOY Kylie Jenner came up with a clanger of a theme for one of hers. An opinion piece on society’s view of singledom resonates deeply with us, while we’re planning our Golden Girls retirement and – for Myf at least – it’ll be on a boat. And the return of an HBO series has Zan absolutely razzed for the sport of watching Streep actor the shit out of it.

item.title: #109: Helicopter Woman, Rich Musicians, DNA Travel | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are spinning you right round baby, right round. Oh boy. Thank you internet. A helicopter rescue has us in tears, meanwhile it’s raining money in Jay-Z and Rihanna’s world but music isn’t necessarily the maker. A strange collab between Ancestry and commerce seems very on the nose, but Myf is consoling herself with Digestives, so we’re all good. Show notes: Helicopter Woman: https://junkee.com/helicopter-woman/208658 Jay-Z billionaire: https://www.

item.title: #108: Bong On, CWA, Fleabag | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are reunited, but reflecting back on a lot of things for good reason this week. A listening-at-half-speed mistake in the Bang Fam has us on the floor, while the CWA is proving that women who band together and fight the good fight, rule. There’s more updates on Moby and Yiayia, while we’re devouring TV shows like nobody's business. And in Breaking Bang, we’re bringing Bang On Live to Brissie for the first time!

item.title: #107: Moby, Cardi B, Celine Carpool Karaoke | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf is dialling in from Rome, in the days following Eurovision, cos she can. A new Moby biography detailing the women he “tried to date” has the internet abuzz and we have thoughts. Oh we have thoughts. Cardi B is proving why her social media rants are always ripe for remixing, and Celine Dion has just won Carpool Karaoke. Meanwhile Myf is sitting down to Wine Country and we’re all moving the Bang Fam to Italy.

item.title: #106: Eurovision, Socks n’ Sandals, Spritz | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are looking at the endless drone of election campaigning, and dark news out of Alabama and sending back a reprieve of light and fluffy fodder for our Bang Fam. With Eurovision in full swing, Myf joins you from bed in Tel Aviv where the sun is just coming up. All the goss from the world’s biggest song competition awaits. Meanwhile fashion has gone a bit State School Science Teacher, but Myf is one step ahead of the curve, and a hot take on Aperol Spritz has the internet abuzz.

item.title: #105: Met Gala, #MyMum, Yiayia Next Door | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description It’s farshun Christmas with the annual Met Gala on show. So many thoughts. So many hot takes. So much to dissect. The Daily Telegraph’s attack on a politician misses the mark on the realities of women’s sacrifice, but the internet restores the balance, and we’re ready to hand over cold hard cash for a unique Madonna meet 'n’ greet. Meanwhile, Yiayia next door is bringing Zan much joy, while Russian spies have got Myf razzed.

item.title: #104: Taylor Swift, Slacker Culture, Sally Rooney | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are in their pastels and digesting the week in pop culture. Tay Tay has been accused of ripping off Bey, but we’re wise to it. A great article about the pendulum swinging back towards slacker culture has us ready for the revival, and the darkness of the latest Game of Thrones was intentional, but not helpful for most of the world’s viewers. Don’t worry, it’s a spoiler free zone.

item.title: #103: Sri Lanka, Chill Music, Adele | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan’s conversations around the differing values of culture in the wake of tragedy rises again, this time following the horrific terrorist attacks in Sri Lanka. On a completely other tip, an article on the rise of chill music has us divided, and the public ownership of pop stars in a time of personal pain, leaves a bad taste in our mouths. In a week of darkness, discrimination of the astrological kind in a share house gives us some light relief.

item.title: #102: Notre Dame, Beyonce, Game of Thrones | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are digesting another big week, and talking about the significance of Notre Dame. The fire in this iconic Parisian building caused a global reaction, but what of the other monuments that receive less attention? Is our value of culture firmly rooted in western traditions? We’ve watched Beyonce’s “Homecoming” film with you, and have plenty of thoughts buzzing in our Beyhive. Game of Thrones has returned for it’s swansong, and we’re diving into some hot takes from it’s debut.

item.title: #101: Black Holes, Death of Genre, Alan Partridge | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are razzed about the photographic evidence of a supermassive black hole, although it’s fair to say Myf is somewhat critical of the quality of the snap. A chart topping, genre defining song has us questioning the value of traditional gatekeepers to everyday music fans. And an article about poo gives us the opportunity to talk about poo. Plus in another world first (soz Black Hole, you’re not the only news today), we’re going Instagram Live for the very first time for a group Bang Fam viewing of the Beyonce doco “Homecoming” on Netflix.

item.title: #100: April Fools, Rock n Roll Hall of Fame, The Century | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan mark 100 episodes of Bang On! Holy hell, where did that time go? April Fools has rolled around, but the foolin’ has made way for the hard sell and we’re more than a little cynical of it all. A red carpet moment from Robert Smith of The Cure has sparked a bigger conversation around entitlement, and an article about reality TV has Myf vindicated. Plus we mark the century with a few memories, and it wouldn’t be an occasion if Beryl didn’t drop by.

item.title: #99: Jagged Little Pill, Mel & Geri, Jundies | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan have found 2019’s first bad take, and we’re digging in. NASA have neglected to sort out spacesuits for a history making spacewalk and we’re facepalming, and news of a Spice Girls romp has us cynical for why we’re hearing it now. Plus there’s a double fashion update, with Myf here for all of it. Show notes: NASA Astronauts: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2019-03-26/nasa-cancels-first-all-female-spacewalk-no-fitting-suits/10942166?pfmredir=sm Make-up kit shuttle: https://airandspace.si.edu/collection-objects/make-kit-shuttle Jagged Little Pill is Actually Very Bad?

item.title: #98: Jacinda’s Leadership, Janet’s Glasto, Car Koala | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan find strength in the compassion and empathy of Jacinda Ardern, and reflect on how differently Australian politicians and media reacted to the Christchurch terrorist attack. Egg Boy has been a beacon of hope in a dark week, but has the focus on him come at the expense of a much harder conversation? Meanwhile Glastonbury has been announced and Janet Jackson has gone the ol’ cut and paste on the poster, and the sweet relief of good news has come in the form of a hitchhiking koala.

item.title: #97: Michael Jackson, Cancellation Culture, 90s Websites | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description It’s another heavy week but thank dog we have each other to debrief with. Myf and Zan have watched the Leaving Neverland documentary, and unpack the way the story was told and the stories we told ourselves. In the wake of the latest allegations, is it possible to cancel a cultural giant? Is it right? And what does it mean for the conversations that are silenced, with it? On a (blessedly) lighter note, an archive of websites from the dawn of the world wide web has us reminiscing about the golden age of fonts, and a college admissions scandal in the States sadly confirms everything we already knew.

item.title: #96: Luke Perry, R Kelly, Flat Earthers | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan digest another, quite frankly, heavy week. After our 90210 reboot chat last week, it was a shock to hear the news of Luke Perry’s sudden death. In the same 24 hours, Keith Flint of The Prodigy also passed. We reflect on what they meant to us, in our formative years. An intense interview between Gayle King and R Kelly has everyone talking, and a tiny farshun update is quite frankly, the release we need this week.

item.title: #95: Oscars, Fat Rat, 90210 | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan relive their favourite moments from the Oscars, and dig into that performance from Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper. A fat rat trapped in a manhole in Germany has brought the world great joy, while a reported reboot of Beverly Hills 90210 isn’t quite what you think it is. And we’re banging on about some heavy stories that need to be told. Show notes: Shallow at the Oscars: https://www.

item.title: #94: Lagerfeld, Zip Jeans, Dirty John | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan reflect on designer Karl Lagerfeld’s legacy, good and bad, in the wake of public reaction to his passing. A story from an Air France flight has us squealing, and our DM’s have been flooded with notifications after Alexander Wang released some very special jeans. And the adaptation of a podcast to the small screen has us completely hooked. Show notes: Anti-Condolences for Lagerfeld: https://wearyourvoicemag.com/culture/anti-condolences-karl-lagerfeld Jameela Jamil on Lagerfeld: https://www.

item.title: #93: Grammys, Ryan Adams, Russian Doll | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan have all eyes on farshun at the Grammy Awards cos that’s what it’s all about, right? A New York Times article on Ryan Adams has us thinking about abuse of power, and the music industry’s day of reckoning. Myf is quizzing Zan on whether her apartment is a man repeller, and we’re shredding through a couple of brilliant Netflix series. Show notes: Eurovision: https://www.sbs.com.au/programs/eurovision Grammys farshun: https://www.

item.title: #92: Superbowl, Hottest 100 Revote, Black Saturday | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are bored shitless by the Superbowl Halftime Show, but the absence of a real headliner has more to say about the power of protest than the lack of Levine’s clothing. A Hottest 100 revote reveals that you shouldn’t mess with history, and confirms that songs can triumph as emotional memory above all else. We’ve got the latest Fyre Festival update, and Myf is overjoyed at a new season of Call My Agent, while Zan is compelled by a brilliant account of an Australian tragedy.

item.title: #91: Hottest 100, KAK + Yumi, Eggshell Skull | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are unpacking what is, on record, the slowest tempo Hottest 100 in history and what it means. The many discussions around Kerri-Anne Kennerly and Yumi Stynes on Studio 10 have us diving in too, while Oscar noms are bringing joy to a certain Brit. The Fyre Fest flow-on online spirals us into interesting new territory, and Zan is saying Konbanwa to the new Terrace House season, while Myf is flicking the pages of a brilliant new Australian book.

item.title: #90: ICYMI, Fyre, Bros | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are back and banging into 2019! We catch up on the important stuff we missed over the break; from Kondo to Cardi B, to the 10 Year Challenge. And in the wake of two excellent docos on the failed Fyre Festival, we unpack the bigger story it tells of where we are right now. There’s farshun, we’re banging on, and most of all we're stoked to be back with the Bang Fam.

item.title: Bonus ep: Year in Review! | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan have a Christmas gift for you! A couple of months back, you may have heard a special Bang On live from the Thornbury Theatre in Melbourne. There was part of that live show that wasn't included in the podcast - but it's here for you now! It’s the Bang On YEAR IN REVIEW! Bang On will be back in your feeds at the end of Jan.

item.title: #89: Goop Gift Guide, Post Malone Crocs, Listmas | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description ‘Tis the season! Myf and Zan wind up Bang On for the year by going shopping with Gwyneth, while Myf has Zan’s stocking stuffed with some limited edition Crocs. End of Year lists have Zan seeing what she missed, and we’re wrapping the year with some of the best shows, podcasts and books to binge over summer. Happy Festivus! Show notes: How many fries to eat: https://www.news.com.au/lifestyle/health/diet/this-is-exactly-how-may-fries-you-can-eat-in-one-serve/news-story/b6cf2a573683babf862b12949d20fb7cGoop Gift Guide: https://goop.

item.title: #88: Victoria's Secrets, The Bad Sex Awards, Goat Yoga | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan discuss the Victoria's Secret show and wonder if it still has a place in 2018 as it is, Zan does a call out to designers urging them to create 'fancy evening wear' for people with curves and Myf is here for the new [potential] craze of Goat Yoga. Plus, it's that time of the year again - The Bad Sex Awards are back! Show notes:

item.title: #87: ARIAs, Knickers, Lena Dunham | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Zan backs up after the ARIA Awards with minimal sleep but maximal stories about Australian music’s night of nights. Knickers the giant cow has everyone talking and we’re here for it. And a long long read about Lena Dunham has us questioning our own reactions to this divisive creator. Meanwhile Melania Trump has decked the halls once again and oh boy, it’s gonna be a bloody Christmas. Show notes:

item.title: #86: Iceberg, Pamela, House of Cards | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan wrap the week of music, art, life and lettuce much like an iceberg wraps it’s perfect self in it’s own glad wrap. We discuss the bogan leaf and it’s comeback, while on telly we’re watching the reactions of different men to Scott Morrison’s comments about Pamela Anderson. The plotline for the doomed Sex and the City 3 movie has been revealed and explains everything about the aforementioned doom, and Myf gets Zan on the couch for some deep therapy in her television choices.

item.title: #85: Pellegrini’s, Peach + Boss, Victim or Vixen | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan wrap the week that was, highs and lows, and farewell a Melbourne icon who welcomed all. Madonna has made an incredible self-aware SIX MINUTE ad for her facial roller and we’re here for it. Channel 10 have rebranded with some unfortunately gendered channel names, in 2018. And in a week of frustrating stories being told by men, of women’s experiences, a piece on Monica Lewinsky has us thinking about who gets to live in victimville.

item.title: #84: Spice Girls, Homesteading, The Good Place | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are ready to spice up your life with another week that was. The rumoured reunion has finally been confirmed, but where’s Posh and why is she posing that way? Myf is hankering for a simpler life and considering joining the Homesteading Movement, and we’ve found a website that lists all the words that became words the year you were born. Hours of fun. Meanwhile we’re banging on about books and TV and singing a bit too.

item.title: #83: Halloween, Horror, Bodyguard | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan and Beyonce are celebrating Halloween in our own little ways, while a timely take on the changing social commentary within horror movies has us thinking. Prince's family are trying to trademark the colour purple (no jokes) and we're a bit flummoxed by that. And we're both a little worn out so watching heaps of Netflix in bed at home. Show notes: Beyonce Halloween: https://www.instagram.com/p/BpkdLlZHH_5/?hl=en&taken-by=beyonceHorror movies with a social conscience: https://junkee.

item.title: #82: Bang On Live in Melbourne | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan bring Bang On to a sold out crowd for the first time ever in Melbs. With homemade badges in hand, they capture the week that was, with the Bang Fam. Rihanna has reportedly turned down the Superbowl Halftime Show in solidarity with quarterback Colin Kaepernick, but does it signal a shift in broadcast power as well? One of the biggest films of the year has opened, and we’re wondering if A Star Is Born pits pop music against “authenticity”.

item.title: #81: Royals, COSMO, Bohemian Rhapsody | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are sussing out the Duke and Duchess of Sussex’s royal visit, and saying farewell to the last women’s mag, on the news of COSMO’s closure. The Banksy art shred gets new life in fashion, as Myf’s curatorial brain gets to work on the meaning behind it all. And we’re gearing up for our own #Farshun parade, with only a few more sleeps till Bang On live in Melbourne.

item.title: #80: Taylor’s politics, Madonna massager, Cher | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are digesting some big news from all corners of the pop sphere. Taylor Swift has broken a career long silence on her politics, making us wonder the why’s, when’s and what for’s of it all. Madonna’s foray into the skin care world has unearthed a pragmatic tool, and Myf has found her magic tickets again to be front row for Cher. Believe. Plus we’re pleading with you to get behind an elaborate hashtag.

item.title: #79: Tampons, Kavanaugh, Kanye | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are celebrating a tax free flow from here on in, with the removal (finally) of the GST on sanitary products. The Kavanaugh-Ford hearings, and reactions, feel like yet another tipping point in the conversation around entitlement, assault and respect. We’re watching closely. And Ye is back at it again, and shredding friends by the second. Meanwhile, preparations for our upcoming Bang On Live event in Melbourne require your participation.

item.title: #78: Plane etiquette, Lily + MIA, Killing Eve | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are connecting deeply with a plane passenger who opened the door of a cockpit looking for a place to charge his phone. An excellent editorial on Lily Allen and MIA staying loud in a world that silences women has us thinking, and a triple breasted fashion show has us not [thinking]. And we’re glued to the laptop screen watching crime (fact and fiction). Show notes:

item.title: #77: Trioli, Qantas, Bert & Ernie | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan connect deeply to an excellent speech Virginia Trioli gave this week on the strength of self and self belief. Qantas has decided to remove music from many flights, and we ponder the responsibilities of our national carrier. And the ARE THEY OR AREN’T THEY question about Bert & Ernie has finally been answered, but it’s Sesame Street’s official response that has us reacting. Show notes:Virginia Trioli speech: http://www.

item.title: #76: Serena, NYFW, The Yoko Effect | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Well, what a week. Zan and Myf digest the event at the Women’s Final of the US Open, the many think-pieces following it, and then that cartoon. New York Fashion Week has Myf glued to her screen for an iconic collection, and in the wake of Mac Miller’s death we look at the backlash against his ex partner Ariana Grande. Why are women demonized in toxic relationships? Oh and we have BIG news for our Bang Fam in Melbourne.

item.title: #75: Neighbours, The Music Canon, Jameela Jamil | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are back in the Bang Fam again, and celebrating the first same sex marriage on Australian screens since marriage equality. An editorial on the death of the traditional music canon has us frothing for the future, and actor/activist Jameela Jamil is calling into question the Kardashians, and breaking the spell. Show notes: Neighbours: https://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2018/sep/04/neighbours-first-same-sex-wedding-reflects-australias-glorious-new-realityBland on Blonde: https://www.theguardian.com/music/2018/aug/29/why-the-old-pop-music-canon-is-finished-greatest-albums-digital-ageJameela Jamil: https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2018/sep/03/jameela-jamil-is-right-the-kardashians-are-double-agents-for-the-patriarchyTonightly: https://www.facebook.com/tonightlyCrazy Rich Asians: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZQ-YX-5bAs0 Email us: bangon.

item.title: #74: Tennis, ASMR, Louis C.K. | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Jan Fran sits in for Myf this week, and the US Open has us talking about more than the tennis with female players being penalised for their uniform approach. A new video of Janet Jackson doing ASMR has us both in a tizz, for very different reasons. And Louis C.K. has returned to stand up, ten months after admitting to sexual misconduct, sparking the question of choice and who gets the power to hold it?

item.title: #73: Aretha, Crazy Rich Asians, Parliament | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Zan and Myf declare Bang On a politics free zone, except if they decide to run for PM. Watch this space. We recognise the legacy of the Queen of Soul, and digest a brilliant editorial from writer Michelle Law about Asian-Australian representation on screen. Show notes: The Party Room: http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/partyroom/podcasts/ Aretha Franklin’s Respect: https://www.vox.com/2018/8/17/17699170/aretha-franklin-2018-respect-song-otis-redding-feminism-civil-rights Why it’s important to see Asian-Australians on screen: https://junkee.com/asian-representation-australia/171514 Happily Never After: https://scribepublications.com.au/books-authors/books/happy-never-after Foreign Correspondent: https://iview.

item.title: #72: Bananas in Pyjamas, Gay Disney, Crocs | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan have been jumping all over Australia together, culminating in their annual hang out with B1 and B2 in Canberra. We say Happy Birthday to an icon, and respond to the news that Disney’s first ever openly gay character will be played by a straight actor. There’s breaking farshun news, and one of the worst hot takes of the week. We got you. Show notes: B1 and B2 Bang On: https://www.

item.title: #71: Oscars, Beyonce's Vogue, Heathers | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are in Darwin in their finest Helen Bidou sarongs, and ready to Bang On in the Top End. The Oscars have announced a new category but why? Beyonce has complete control over Vogue's biggest issue of the year, and she's using her platform once again. And the 30th birthday of Heathers has Zan thinking about the hero that was Veronica Sawyer. Show notes: Oscars: https://news.avclub.com/oscars-add-best-popular-film-category-for-the-uncultu-1828194090Beyonce: https://www.

item.title: #70: Lee Lin, Celine, Bluesfest | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan pay tribute to a KWEEN, on the announcement of a legendary newsreader and cultural icon. Zan recounts the transformative experience of Celine Dion live, while the 30th birthday announcement of Bluesfest seems to be missing something. There’s a farshun update that has us hitting the shops (finally), and Myf is banging on about a show that’s described as Breaking Bad meets Steel Magnolia’s. Meanwhile Zan is glued to a compelling new podcast.

item.title: #69: Pilot Week, Splendour, Whitney | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are celebrating an episode milestone this week, but it’s unlikely they’ll make a big deal out of it. Meanwhile Channel 10 has let us know that there are plenty of funny men to watch on screen, and off the back of Splendour In the Grass, Zan is wondering whether it’s more about the headlines than the headliners. The power of all the senses is explored in a brilliant piece on restaurant music, and we’re banging on about two excellent doco’s about incredible women.

item.title: #68: Queen’s brooches, Madonna, You Can’t Ask That | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf is back in her Thai fisherman’s pants from holidays, and joining Zan to dissect the incredible trolling via brooch that Queen Elizabeth just unleashed. A great editorial on Madonna’s life-changing influence on a young gay fella has us again praising the power of platform, and Zan is binging TV while Myf is banging on about books. Show notes: Queen’s Brooch Troll: https://www.thepoke.co.uk/2018/07/17/queen-trolled-donald-trump-brooch-best-thing-youll-read-today/2/Matt Cain on Madonna: https://www.theguardian.com/music/2018/jul/15/matt-cain-on-madonna-homophobic-interviewers-gay-culture?CMP=fb_guViv Albertine: https://www.

item.title: #67: NAIDOC, Drake, Dog Ice Creams | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf is still living the island lyfe, so Brooke Boney joins Zan to bang on about 'Black Christmas'. Drake is searching for legitimacy, but is he making the art to justify it? And a viral video of a dog and it’s owner sharing an ice cream has us pondering our own sharesies. And Zan is seeing farshun on screen, while BB has a thinkpiece to recommend. Show notes:

item.title: #66: Logies, Leyonheljm, Overly Woke | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf is in the tropics, so Zan invites Jan Fran from The Feed to join the Bang Fam. Jan attended the Logies, so of course Zan grills her about that. Senator Leyonheljm’s comments about a fellow senator has the internet ablaze, and arguments around free-speech and slut-shaming are front and centre once again. And Zan is enjoying some Tracey Ullman gold while Jan has a podcast to share. Show notes:

item.title: #65: BDE, The Notebook, The Staircase | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Zan is back from holidays and just in time for the internet to gift us with some Big Dick Energy. It makes sense once you listen. Myf catches up on Zan’s Greek Island adventures, and finds out which tv shows and movies she cried to on the plane. And a new Netflix show has everyone talking. Show notes: Milos: http://www.cntraveller.com/gallery/milos-greeceBig Dick Energy: https://www.thecut.com/2018/06/pete-davidson-ariana-grande-big-dick-energy.htmlOn The Run II: https://www.beyonce.com/The Staircase: https://www.

item.title: #64: Whoppers, The Carters, The Nanny | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Zan is away on her final week of holidays, so Monique Bowley is back in the Bang Gang. Myf and Mon dissect Beyonce and Jay-Z's latest masterpiece, discuss whether The Handmaid's Tale is getting too hard to watch, plus - are we looking forward to a potential Nanny reboot?! Show Notes: Burger King in Russia: https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2018/06/20/sorry-you-no-longer-get-a-free-burger-king-whopper-if-you-have-a-world-cup-stars-baby/?utm_term=.78e954d6c472 Handmaid's Tale: https://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2018/jun/16/handmaids-tale-season-2-elisabeth-moss-margaret-atwood The Carters: https://www.newyorker.com/culture/culture-desk/what-it-means-when-beyonce-and-jay-z-take-over-the-louvre The Nanny: https://www.news.com.au/entertainment/tv/flashback/fran-drescher-confirms-shes-in-talks-to-reboot-the-nanny/news-story/9564a4ec9450b81ec50ed7562fcdf87a Farshun: http://junkee.com/kath-kim-runway-models/164157 Queer Eye: https://www.

item.title: #63: Family Feud, Bourdain, Haim | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf is joined again this week by Monique Bowley, where they discuss Anthony Bourdain’s impact on food journalism and his role as an ally of the #metoo movement, dissect Haim’s bold pay parity move AND marvel at the Kardashian-West family’s uncharacteristic ugg boot and tracksuit pant moment: appearing on Family Feud! Show notes: Kardasian-Wests on Family Feud: https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/arts-and-entertainment/wp/2018/06/11/no-one-has-ever-been-as-happy-as-kanye-west-on-celebrity-family-feud Anthony Bourdain dies: http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-06-08/anthony-bourdain-dies-aged-61-cnn-says/9851840 Confessions of journalists covering celebrity deaths: https://digiday.

item.title: #62: Queer Eye in Yass, SATC, Miss America Swimsuits | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Zan’s away but the Bang Gang still plays and this week we welcome Monique Bowley into the Bang Fam. Myf and Monique reassess Sex And The City through woke eyes on its 20th anniversary, discover what the Queer Eye crew were really doing in Yass and mull over Miss America ditching the togs for clogs. Show Notes: Queer Eye in Yass: https://twitter.com/NetflixANZ/status/1004452348423360512 Why do today's feminists hate Sex And The City: https://www.

item.title: #61: Roseanne, Kim K and Trump, Wild Wild Country | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description The star of TV’s biggest comeback has just been brought back down to earth, but how much of a surprise is her social media demise? The strangest pic on Trump’s twitter feed has us in a tizz, and there’s a #Farshun update that contains no denim but all style. Meanwhile Myf is watching docos on cults, while Zan is dipping into music industry history. Show notes: Roseanne: https://www.theguardian.com/culture/2018/may/29/roseanne-cancelled-what-happened-tweets-rise-fall-tv-biggest-showTrump and Kimmy K: https://twitter.

item.title: #60: Reverend Curry, Arrested Development, Westworld | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan debrief on the epic sermon from Reverend Michael Curry at the Royal Wedding, and ponder the power of that speech. Ahead of the recut new season of Arrested Development, a New York Times interview with the cast has done more harm than good. And Beyonce bought a church. Cos she’s Beyonce. Show notes: Michael Curry’s speech will go down in history: https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/may/20/bishop-michael-curry-sermon-history-harry-meghan-weddingMaxine Beneba Clarke’s Twitter thread: https://twitter.

item.title: #59: Spotify, The Americans, Jeggings | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf’s dedication to the Bang Fam knows no bounds as she joins Zan from the London airport lounge to talk post Eurovision goss and the buffet spread highlights. A new Spotify policy has us once again considering the conversation around the separation of art and the artist. Zan has been devouring The Americans final season, why Myf is finding time on planes to read debut novels by Australian musicians.

item.title: #58: Eurovision, Met Gala, Childish Gambino | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf is in Lisbon but nothing stops her from joining the Bang Fam for a gossip about the world of glitter, high drama and musical diplomacy. The Met Gala was a treat for the eyes, but was the theme a bit on the nose? And Childish Gambino’s new video (and song) is peak think-piece fodder, for good reason. Show notes: Eurovision: https://www.sbs.com.au/programs/eurovisionMet Gala: https://www.vogue.com/tag/event/met-galaChildish Gambino: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/05/08/arts/music/childish-gambino-this-is-america-roundup.htmlI’m Not Black, I’m Kanye: https://www.

item.title: #57: Michelle Wolf, Janelle Monae, The Handmaids Tale | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan have been diving into the many reviews and think-pieces following the White House Correspondent’s dinner monologue by comedian Michelle Wolf. Meanwhile Janelle Monae has released one of the albums of the year, with an “emotion picture” to boot. And the fate of a band’s album was once in the hands of Pitchfork reviews, but does it still have the power to make or break? There’s a bonus pre-bang too, cos we love our Bang Fam (and want to warn you against bad decisions).

item.title: #56: Royal baby, Avicii, Paddlesteamers | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan and every other woman in the world are surprised about the time between childbirth and royal presentation of the new Prince, and have thoughts on that. The death of Avicii causes us to ponder the duty of care in not-so-traditional work environments, and Shania Twain has been copping heat for her perceived support of Trump. Meanwhile, Zan has been in Moscow, while Myf is on the Murray and we’re good with both.

item.title: #55: Kanye, Kendrick, Beyoncé | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description What a week. Myf and Zan are stoked to see Kanye back on Twitter, and unveiling his book of philosophy in real time. Kendrick Lamar has made history as the first rapper to win the Pulitzer Prize for Music. And we invite special guest Nkechi Anele into the Bang Fam Beyhive to unwrap the enormity that was Beychella. Kanye tweets: https://twitter.com/kanyewestKendrick Lamar Pulitzer: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/04/17/arts/music/kendrick-lamar-music-pulitzer-prize-damn.htmlDaily Fail: http://junkee.com/daily-mail-bachelor-vapid/154733Beychella: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/04/15/arts/music/beyonce-coachella-review.htmlThe Pin: https://www.

item.title: #54: Yo-Yo’s, Janelle Monae, The Breakfast Club revisited | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Zan asks a question about Yo Yo biscuits that gets way out of hand, and we could have an early winner of 2018 farshun with the release of Janelle Monae’s new videoclip. Molly Ringwald has been watching her own films again and seeing them in a new light, while Myf has been hanging out with Helen Bidou. Show notes: Yo-Yo’s: http://vanillawings.blogspot.com.au/2011/05/melting-moments-yo-yos.htmlJanelle Monae: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PaYvlVR_BEcWhat About The Breakfast Club?: https://www.newyorker.com/culture/personal-history/what-about-the-breakfast-club-molly-ringwald-metoo-john-hughes-pretty-in-pinkThe Death of Stalin: https://www.

item.title: #53: Opening Ceremonies, Men Write Women, Russell Crowe | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan recap the confusing and wonderful and very Surfers Paradise Commonwealth Games Opening Ceremony, while catching up on some fine representations of women in literature. Russell Crowe’s divorce auction has us saving our pennies, and we sing again. Why not eh? Show notes: Opening Ceremony: http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-04-04/commonwealth-games-2018-opening-ceremony-gold-coast-live-blog/9619078Men Write Women: https://www.theguardian.com/books/booksblog/2018/apr/03/male-authors-write-female-characters-twitterRussell Crowe’s Divorce Auction: http://junkee.com/russell-crowe-divorce-auction/150533Bluesfest: http://doublej.net.au/news/features/13-unforgettable-moments-of-bluesfest-2018-The Trauma Cleaner: https://www.textpublishing.com.au/books/the-trauma-cleaner-one-woman-s-extraordinary-life-in-death-decay-disasterEmail us: bangon.podcast@abc.net.au Transcript

item.title: #52: Bang On bangs back | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description We reach out to the Bang Fam for tips on what you’ve been loving or loathing, and you deliver once again! Emma tells you about a new all female Western on Netflix, Holly riffs on Party Hard legend Andrew W.K.’s first new music in yonks, and Erin goes where many others have feared to tread; to Darren Aronofsky’s “Mother!”. Godless: https://www.netflix.com/au/title/80097141Andrew W.K.: http://andrewwk.com/news/new-album-out-now-andrew-wk-releases-youre-not-alone#disqus_threadMother! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XpICoc65uh0Email us: bangon.podcast@abc.net.au Transcript

item.title: #51: Detroit House, Facebook, RIP Keyboard Cat | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan discover their dream home in Detroit and start saving for it. The Cambridge Analytica story has us thinking again about how much we allow Facebook into our lives, and Cynthia Nixon’s run for NY Governor has us pondering the celebrity politician. And it’s a sad farewell to Bento, the Keyboard Cat, with his stiff little arms bringing the world so much joy. Show notes: Detroit House: https://www.

item.title: #50: 1970’s food, Honey Bachelor, The Long Read | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan ponder over the hideousness of 1970’s food, as Zan plans for a themed dinner party. Nick Cummins AKA The Honey Badger has been announced as the next Bachelor and of course we have thoughts. And an online piece that everyone is talking about has us wondering, is the long form read making a comeback? Show notes: 1970’s Dinner Party: https://twitter.com/70s_partyNick Cummins is The Bachelor: https://thefix.nine.com.au/2018/03/15/05/08/nick-cummins-confirmed-as-the-bachelor-2018Worst Roommate Ever: http://nymag.

item.title: #49: Mardi Gras, Oscars, NME | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan debrief on their Mardi Gras parties, and dig into the insane goodie bags that Oscars attendees receive. The NME is calling it a day in print form, which has Myf reflecting on the beating heart of music journalism as a fan, and emerging writer. And we’re celebrating International Women’s Day. That’s every day, in our world tbh. Show notes: Mardi Gras 2018: https://www.sbs.com.au/ondemand/video/1164538947938/Sydney-Gay-and-Lesbian-Mardi-Gras-2018Oscars goodie bag: https://www.

item.title: #48: Perth, 50/50 Festivals, Dolce Drones | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Zan is in Perth and very excited about music and stadiums, while Myf is reminding us of Zan’s Perth past. Music Festivals in the UK are pledging gender equality by 2022, in the same week an Australian festival announces an entirely male line-up, and it’s time for another Farshun update. Isn’t every week Farshun Week on Bang On? Show notes: Perth Stadium: https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=2&v=sjBjuvyAUTEGender equality at music festivals: http://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-43196414Dolce & Gabbana Drones: https://www.

item.title: #47: Xenophon Rap, Black Panther, #MAFS | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan get sucked into a seasoned politicians stutter rap, and bask in the glory (and many think-pieces) around the latest Marvel blockbuster. Myf is viewing Married At First Sight in “omnibus” form and explains what that, and the show, means to Zan. And in between we’re on another planet, forgive us, Bang Fam. Show notes: Xenophon Rap: https://www.sbs.com.au/news/a-rapping-and-dancing-xenophon-courts-sa-voters-in-campaign-adBlack Panther Round Up: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/20/watching/black-panther-movie-roundup.html?smid=fb-nytimes&smtyp=curMarried At First Sight: https://www.9now.com.au/married-at-first-sight/season-5Hunger: https://www.

item.title: #46: Queer Eye, Obama Portrait, Lady Bird | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan have been soaking up the reboot of Queer Eye, and wading through the internet’s hot takes on it’s relevance in 2018. There’s another face app kicking around, so of course we’ve given it a burl, and the world of political portraiture is changing and we’re here for it. Plus we’ve found a cross section between the Winter Olympics and farshun. Gold medal podcast, tbh. Show notes:

item.title: #45: Quincy Jones, Super Bowl, Elon Musk | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are thanking the internet angels for a Q&A with Quincy that is giving us life. The Super Bowl halftime show fell a little flat except for one saving grace, and Zan is very excited about rockets and space while Myf is devouring books on creativity. Oh and there’s a Farshun update. Show notes: Quincy Jones in Conversation: http://www.vulture.com/2018/02/quincy-jones-in-conversation.htmlSelfie Kid: http://time.com/5133184/selfie-kid-justin-timberlake-super-bowl-halftime-show/Falcon Heavy: http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-02-07/spacex-rocket-takes-sports-car-into-space/9403618Farshun: https://www.teenvogue.com/story/unravel-project-debuts-denim-belt-for-dollar400?mbid=social_twitterGoing Greyscale: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/12/technology/grayscale-phone.htmlBig Magic: https://www.

item.title: #44: Shania, Lorde, IKEA | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan get excited about big tours coming, and Michael Bolton on a Tuesday. The founder of IKEA has died but left a flatpack legacy that has become the cornerstone of all relationships. And Lorde is gone but not forgotten from the Grammy stage and we have thoughts on that. Show notes: Michael Bolton Tuesdays: https://www.instagram.com/p/BekZ7Z9ACtB/?taken-by=zanroweShania Twain Touring: http://www.smh.com.au/entertainment/music/shania-twain-announces-first-australian-tour-in-almost-two-decades-20180131-h0rl61.htmlIKEA Founder Dies: https://thenewdaily.com.au/news/people/2018/01/29/ikea-founder-ingvar-kamprad-dies/Lorde (not) at Grammys: http://variety.com/2018/music/news/why-isnt-lorde-performing-at-the-grammys-sources-explain-1202679146/Parliament House: https://www.

item.title: #43: ICYMI, Google Arts and Culture App, I, Tonya | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are back after summer break and speed rounding their way around the summer. A new app taps into art and narcissism and we love it, and more tech giant founders are talking about the addictions we’re lured into, with our smart phones. And we’ve been busy watching depictions of real people on screen, high and low brow alike. Show notes: Google Arts and Culture App: https://www.

item.title: Bang On Recommends: The Real Thing | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description The Real Thing celebrates unique Australian characters. On this episode: Meet Lizzy Gardiner. Her early life included minimal supervision, late nights at the Dubbo drive-in and a stint in Papua New Guinea. Lizzy's unusual experiences made her a perfect fit for the turbulent film industry, where she won an Oscar for the costumes in Priscilla, Queen of the Desert. But she never thought a bold decision to wear a dress made out of credit cards would be part of her legacy.

item.title: Bang On Recommends: How Do You Sleep At Night? | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description How Do You Sleep At Night? is a new podcast hosted by Hack’s Sarah McVeigh. It’s about people who live their lives in the face of judgement. On this episode: Charlie stabbed and killed two innocent men on a night out in Brisbane in the '90s. Retrace the night he took their lives, meet his mum and discover how he lives with himself. And a warning — there’s very strong language in this episode.

item.title: #42: Bonus Bang On | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description A special treat from Bang On Live, Myf & Zan give out awards for Artist Of The Year, Bang Backer Of The Year and of course, the greatest moment in #farshun Transcript

item.title: #41: Cat Person, MeNoMore, Vegemite Icy Poles | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan talk about the short story every else has been talking about this week, and reflect on the huge year of uprising in the wake of Harvey Weinstein. It’s been epic. A refresher in the form of Vegemite icy poles has one of us excited, and with holidays on the horizon we’re banging on about stuff one last time. Thanks for being the best Bang Fam a coupla women could dream for.

item.title: #40: Job swaps, Paul McCartney, Sia | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description It’s been a huge week for Myf and Zan, and we talk about all the ch-ch-ch-changes in our working and creative worlds in 2018. Zan has been hanging out with Paul McCartney, so lets you know what went down when the microphones weren’t on, and Sia’s rejection of fame has been called into question in her use of Maddie Ziegler as her public face. Show notes: Zan’s new gig: http://www.

item.title: #39: ARIAs, Bad Sex Awards, Harry and Meghan | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Zan gives the goss on what happened backstage at the ARIA Awards when she was wearing Myf’s clothes (creep), and the annual Bad Sex Awards for literature have begun again! We’re talking Royal Family news and how “woke” the Windsors are becoming, and banging on about banging. Kind of. It’s been a big week. Show notes: Backstage at the ARIAs: https://www.instagram.com/p/BcCBONHAxIh/?taken-by=zanroweMeghan Markle’s lineage: http://www.newsweek.com/prince-harrys-fiancee-meghan-markle-related-william-shakespeare-and-winston-726068Bad Sex in Literature shortlist: https://www.

item.title: #38: Bird of the Year, Emo’s problem with women, Nanette | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan are all in on The Guardian’s bird poll, and casting our votes. Allegations of sexual misconduct have been made against the lead singer of Brand New, unleashing more than a couple of think-pieces on mid 00’s emo music’s problem with women. And Zan has been reading from the paper of a 10 year old journalist, while Myf is floored by Hannah Gadsby’s swan song. Show notes:

item.title: #37: Bang On Live at Giant Dwarf for Yack Festival | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan bang on in front of a sold out crowd of Bang Fam, in Sydney. Former Facebook President Sean Parker has called out the social media giant for their exploitation of human vulnerability, while Zan wonders if Taylor’s new media strategy is doing the same. We actively choose to watch Bad Moms Christmas and have many thoughts on that, and it’s interesting how salty we can get when we have a crowd cheering us on.

item.title: #36: Sia Nudes, Britney Spears art, Noel Gallagher's scissors solo | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan rejoice at Sia taking control of her leaked naked photo, celebrate Britney Spears’ unleashing of her inner Monet with her foray into visual art and applaud Noel Gallagher’s crafty use of scissors as a musical instrument. Show notes: Sia nude fightback - https://www.theguardian.com/media/shortcuts/2017/nov/07/how-to-style-out-a-naked-photo-leak-sias-approach-is-just-one-of-a-few-options Britney is an artist now - https://www.vanityfair.com/style/2017/11/britney-spears-art-sold-for-ten-thousand-dollars RIP Paddles - https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/nov/08/paddles-first-cat-of-new-zealand-dies-hit-by-car-jacinda-ardern Noel Gallagher’s scissors solo - http://www.nme.com/blogs/nme-blogs/noel-had-someone-playing-scissors-last-night-and-people-are-confused-2155344 Diddy is Love - https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/diddy-i-was-only-joking-about-that-name-change/

item.title: #35: Lion King remake, Butter Shortage, Highly Vaginal Album Art | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Zan is stoked about the cast announcement for The Lion King but Myf seems more keen to talk about the impending butter shortage worldwide. The sexual harassment house of cards continues to fall in Hollywood, while airlines are filling aisles with live music. And Bjork’s highly vaginal artwork has us googling inappropriate things at work. Again. Lion King cast announced: http://www.abc.net.au/news/2017-11-02/the-lion-king-beyonce-to-star-as-nala/9111180 Hollywood’s house of cards: http://www.abc.net.au/news/2017-11-02/hollywood-sex-accusations-now-levelled-at-ratner-hoffman/9110048 Butter crisis: http://www.

item.title: #34: Stu or Jarrod, Kate Nash, Dirty John | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan can’t / don’t want to predict The Bachelorette finale, meanwhile hungry “hot content” creators are dismissing artists willy-nilly. There’s a farshun update from Tokyo Farshun week, and we’ve been devouring other podcasts about people who do bad things. item.title: #33: Lisa Wilkinson, CD Collections, Molto Bene | Bang On
item.description: Podcast Description Myf and Zan catch up where wages don’t, on parity. An article about keeping or turfing their CD collections has them pondering the past again, and they bond over high school Italian for no reason whatsoever. Show notes: Lisa Wilkinson and the gender pay gap: http://www.abc.net.au/news/2017-10-19/lisa-wilkinson-gender-pay-gap-your-stories/9063812Is It Time To Get Rid of Your CD Collection: http://doublej.net.au/news/features/that-cd-collection-youve-got-time-to-sellTheir Grotesque Indifference: https://meanjin.com.au/blog/their-grotesque-indifference/Pretty For An Aboriginal: https://itunes.apple.com/gb/podcast/pretty-for-an-aboriginal/id1282132573?mt=2 Transcript
